Content.BodyCopy:
What are Three-Day Programs?

During the summer, Badger Creek offers Three-day programs. With the help of a staff of well-trained people, your group will be able to have a character-building experience, while enjoying the great outdoors. Badger Creek Three-day Programs, located at the BYU-Idaho Outdoor Learning Center, are outdoor youth programs designed to teach leadership and engage students in intense activities, including ropes courses and other outdoor adventures. Groups will do a number of workshops within their  schedule to enhance their experience at Badger Creek. The 2013 Three-day Program Workshops will  include the following:

  • Canoeing
  • Climbing Tower/Zip Line
  • Team Building Workshop
  • Inclined/Horizontal Log
  • Giant Swing
  • Horseback Riding or Black Powder Rifle

For more information, please see the FAQ's page.

Participation Information

Badger Creek  Three-day Programs are designed primarily for LDS youth groups. Participation is limited to such groups as Youth Conferences, Young Women Camps, Scouting activities, etc.

Note: In order to use any of the facilities at Badger Creek, each member of your group must sign a Liability Waiver . Print  a form for each member of your group. If under 18, a parent or guardian must sign the form. The forms must be given to the Manager at Badger Creek in order to participate. Also, please print off, read and plan to follow  what is stated on the Rules and Information sheet

Cost Information

The cost to participate in the Badger Three-day Programs is dependent on the program options chosen by the participating group. The 2012 price is shown below:

  • $112 per person for three days, including the following:

Day one--lunch and dinner

Day two--breakfast, lunch, and dinner

Day three--breakfast and lunch provided only

Note:  All workshop prices are included in the price shown above, excluding the horseback riding workshop. An additional $10 per person will be added to the amount when choosing to ride horses, rather than the black powder rifle option.

A deposit of $100 is needed at time of registration in order to hold your reservation. This is non-refundable but will be put towards your total cost.

Please note that because the food is ordered and confirmed in advance for the amount of people in the group, these are set prices regardless of anyone in the group arriving late or leaving early.

What types of accommodations/meals are available for Three-Day Programs?

Lodging

Badger Creek can accommodate up to 90 people. Normally, participants will stay in tents or tepees (provided by BYU-Idaho) set up in designated camping areas.

Meals

Meals are provided for the three-day program starting with lunch on the first day and ending with lunch on the last day. Meals are prepared in the kitchen facility at Badger Creek Ranch and served in one of the nearby pavilions.

Registration Information

Registration goes fast. Please register by calling (208) 456-2531.
